name: Missing Title Tag
description: Page does not have an HTML title tag.
recommendation: Add a unique, descriptive title tag between 30-60 characters to every page.

name: Title Tag Too Long
description: Title tag exceeds 60 characters and will be truncated in search results.
recommendation: Trim title tags to under 60 characters while keeping primary keywords near the start.

name: Title Tag Too Short
description: Title tag is under 30 characters, missing valuable keyword real estate.
recommendation: Expand the title tag to 30-60 characters. Include the primary keyword and brand name.

name: Missing Meta Description
description: Page does not have a meta description tag. Google may generate one automatically, often poorly.
recommendation: Write a compelling 70-160 character meta description with the primary keyword and a clear value proposition.

name: Meta Description Too Long
description: Meta description exceeds 160 characters and will be truncated by search engines.
recommendation: Trim meta description to under 160 characters. Put the most compelling information first.

name: Thin Content Page
description: Page contains fewer than 300 words, which may signal low-quality content to search engines.
recommendation: Expand content to at minimum 500-1000 words for competitive pages. Focus on depth, not word count.

name: Missing H1 Heading
description: Page has no H1 heading element, which is a primary on-page ranking signal.
recommendation: Add a single H1 containing the primary target keyword. Should be unique across the site.

name: Uppercase Characters in URL
description: URL contains uppercase letters, which can cause duplicate content issues as URLs are case-sensitive.
recommendation: Use only lowercase URLs. Implement 301 redirects from uppercase to lowercase versions.
